column1: Many medicines can help you control your blood pressure.

Your doctor will: - Prescribe the best medicine for you - Monitor your medicines - Make changes if needed Older adults tend to take more medicines and this puts them at greater risk for harmful side effects.
One side effect of blood pressure medicine is an increased risk for falls.
In addition to taking medicine, you can do many things to help control your blood pressure.
Some of these include: - Limit the amount of sodium (salt) you eat.
- Limit how much alcohol you drink, no more than 1 drink a day for women and 2 a day for men.
For people with very high blood pressure, this is when they are most at risk for heart attack and stroke.
Your doctor will give you a physical exam and check your blood pressure often.
